It conducts research and development in areas such as liquid propulsion engines, combustion chambers, and materials testing for dependable performance in aerospace and energy generation applications, emphasizing fatigue life prediction.
reason_for_target_sent: The original sentence refers to DLR Site Lampoldshausen, which specializes in propulsion systems and aerospace applications. ISRO's Propulsion Complex (IPC) in Chandranagar, Bengaluru, India, has similar functions and expertise in this field. The localized sentence provides a more accurate representation of the institution for the target location, Bengaluru. claim_ref: Intense Tropical Cyclone Enawo was the strongest tropical cyclone of the 2016-17 South-West Indian Ocean cyclone season. Enawo was the strongest tropical cyclone to strike Madagascar since Gafilo in 2004, killing 78 people and causing $400 million in damages.
claim_target: Severe Cyclonic Storm Titli was the strongest tropical cyclone to hit Odisha in the 2018-19 Bay of Bengal cyclone season. Titli was the strongest tropical cyclone to strike Odisha since Phailin in 2013, killing 85 people and causing INR 20 billion (approximately $400 million) in damages.
reason_for_target_sent: The original claim refers to Cyclone Enawo, which affected Madagascar in 2017. To localize it for Odisha, I chose Cyclone Titli which was the strongest cyclone in the Bay of Bengal cyclone season 2018-19 and had significant impact on Odisha. The details about damages and casualties have been adjusted accordingly to match Cyclone Titli's impact on Odisha in 2018.

claim_ref: Vietnam is the world's largest producer and exporter of culinary black pepper. The value of black pepper exported from Vietnam is in billions. The destinations for it's exports are India, China, United States, United Arab Emirates, Germany and many other countries.
claim_target: India is one of the largest importers of culinary black pepper. The value of black pepper imported into India is in billions. The origins of its imports include Vietnam, Indonesia, Brazil, Sri Lanka, and many other countries.
reason_for_target_sent: After localizing the sentence for India, it's important to clarify that India is one of the major importers of black pepper rather than being an exporter due to its substantial demand for pepper in its culinary industry. The other changes reflect accurate countries that export black pepper to India.

claim_ref: The Monkey King or Sun Wukong is a fictional character best known as one of the main players in the 16th-century Chinese novel Journey to the West, and many later stories and adaptations. In the novel, Sun Wukong is a monkey born from a stone who acquires supernatural powers through Taoist practices.
claim_target: The Monkey King or Bam Kumar is a fictional character best known as one of the main players in the 16th-century Bengali novel Journey to the East, and many later stories and adaptations. In the novel, Bam Kumar is a monkey born from a stone who acquires supernatural powers through Hindu practices.
reason_for_target_sent: In order to adapt this for West Bengal, I have replaced the Chinese elements with Bengali equivalents while maintaining the original storyline's essence. The Monkey King becomes Bam Kumar, Journey to the West changes to Journey to the East, and Taoist practices are replaced with Hindu practices which are more relatable in West Bengal.

claim_ref: Matsuo Bashō, born Matsuo Kinsaku, later known as Matsuo Chūemon Munefusa, was the most famous Japanese poet of the Edo period. During his lifetime, Bashō was recognized for his works in the collaborative haikai no renga form; today, after centuries of commentary, he is recognized as the greatest master of haiku.
claim_target: Ravindranath Tagore, born as Ravindranath Thakur, later known as Gurudev, was the most famous Indian poet of the British era. During his lifetime, Tagore was recognized for his works in the collaborative poem forms; today, after centuries of commentary, he is recognized as the greatest master of classical poetry.
reason_for_target_sent: Ravindranath Tagore was a prominent Indian poet and polymath who contributed significantly to art, literature, music, and philosophy. He was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature in 1913 for his profoundly sensitive, fresh, and beautiful verse, by which he has made his poetic thought, expressed in his own English words, a part of the literature of the West. By replacing Matsuo Bashō with Ravindranath Tagore, we can introduce an influential poet from India who was recognized during his lifetime for his contributions to poetry in various collaborative forms. This change also maintains factual accuracy regarding Tagore's achievements and significance in Indian literature.
